title: The application panicked (crashed).
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (477b345 2023-12-18T00:22:09.434601489Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test, forge clean, forge update, and maybe more

### Operating System

Windows

### Describe the bug

**Problem** 
When attempting to execute `forge test` on my project, an unexpected error occurred, resulting in the following messages:
```
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  failed to extract foundry config:
foundry.toml error: Input/output error (os error 5)
 in foundry.toml TOML file

Location: crates/config/src/lib.rs:465

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
Aborted
```

Additionally, when including RUST_BACKTRACE=FULL, the extended result is:
```
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  failed to extract foundry config:
foundry.toml error: Input/output error (os error 5)
 in foundry.toml TOML file

Location: crates/config/src/lib.rs:465

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

  ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ BACKTRACE ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
   1: __libc_start_main<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>

Run with COLORBT_SHOW_HIDDEN=1 environment variable to disable frame filtering.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
Aborted
```

Even after executing forge clean and forge update, the issue persists. Furthermore, when navigating to other projects, the same error messages continue to appear. I am currently using Windows 11 and running Foundry with WSL.
